private_information: You specialize in extracting STRIPS-like action schemas from informal text without inventing new predicates or objects.
Assume classical, deterministic, instantaneous actions with add and delete effects only.
Preserve exact predicate and object names as given: hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect; objects are object_0 to object_8.
world_modeler.goal: Provide a concise, machine-readable list of action schemas with parameters, preconditions, add-effects, and delete-effects that matches the public information.

private_information: You normalize multiple problem statements into a unified view with explicit object roster, initial states per case, and goal conditions.
You do not emit PDDL; you output a compact mapping and normalization summary suitable for downstream compilation.
Preserve symbol names exactly and avoid adding new predicates or objects.
state_aligner.goal: Aggregate and normalize the domain objects, initial conditions, goals, and any user-suggested plans from the public information into a single alignment artifact.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency of any proposed grounded plan(s) against the action schemas.
Remove bookkeeping shortcuts, quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any meta-reasoning artifacts that do not correspond to actual domain predicates or actions.
Report unsupported steps, missing preconditions, or threatened causal links and, where possible, provide minimally edited repairs.
consistency_auditor.goal: Verify causal soundness of user-suggested plans and produce an audit report with corrected sequences when feasible.

private_information: You integrate upstream artifacts and produce final planning artifacts for a classical planner.
Target the Fast Downward solver; use standard STRIPS-style PDDL without durative actions, numeric fluents, or ADL constructs beyond simple negation in goals.
When multiple problem statements are present, prefer compiling a single problem for the last statement unless explicitly instructed otherwise.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file, ready for Fast Downward, covering the last problem statement in the public information.

public_information: Domain overview: deterministic classical planning with objects object_0 to object_8 and predicates hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect.
Action paltry(x0, x1, x2): preconditions are hand x0; cats x1; texture x2; vase x0 x1; next x1 x2; add-effects are next x0 x2; delete-effects are vase x0 x1.
Action sip(x0, x1, x2): preconditions are hand x0; cats x1; texture x2; next x0 x2; next x1 x2; add-effects are vase x0 x1; delete-effects are next x0 x2.
Action clip(x0, x1, x2): preconditions are hand x0; sneeze x1; texture x2; next x1 x2; next x0 x2; add-effects are vase x0 x1; delete-effects are next x0 x2.

Action wretched(x0, x1, x2, x3): preconditions are sneeze x0; texture x1; texture x2; stupendous x3; next x0 x1; collect x1 x3; collect x2 x3; add-effects are next x0 x2; delete-effects are next x0 x1.
Action memory(x0, x1, x2): preconditions are cats x0; spring x1; spring x2; next x0 x1; add-effects are next x0 x2; delete-effects are next x0 x1.
Action tightfisted(x0, x1, x2): preconditions are hand x0; sneeze x1; texture x2; next x1 x2; vase x0 x1; add-effects are next x0 x2; delete-effects are vase x0 x1.

Statement A initial conditions: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_3; hand object_8; next object_0 object_7; next object_1 object_7; next object_4 object_6; next object_5 object_7; next object_8 object_7; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_7; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7.
Statement A goal: next object_8 object_6.
Statement A user-proposed plan: sip object_8 object_1 object_7; memory object_1 object_7 object_6; paltry object_8 object_1 object_6.

Statement B initial conditions: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_2; hand object_7; hand object_8; next object_0 object_6; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_6; next object_7 object_6; next object_8 object_5; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_6; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6.
Statement B goals: next object_7 object_6 and next object_8 object_6.

structure.system_prompt: You are a planning-domain abstraction expert. From the public information, extract STRIPS-like action schemas exactly as stated without inventing objects or predicates; do not emit PDDL; output a compact machine-readable list of actions with fields name, parameters, preconditions, add, del.
structure.prompt: Your name is world_modeler. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->world_modeler->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->world_modeler->goal}. Produce the action schema summary with precise symbol spelling.

mapping.system_prompt: You normalize multiple statements into a single alignment artifact: enumerate objects, compile each statement's initial facts and goals, and relay any user-proposed plan; do not emit PDDL; keep exact symbol names.
mapping.prompt: Your name is state_aligner. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->state_aligner->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->state_aligner->goal}. Use the action schema summary: {model_action_schemas}. Output a concise alignment with sections: objects, statement_A_init, statement_A_goal, statement_A_plan, statement_B_init, statement_B_goals.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency of any provided grounded plans against the action schemas and remove bookkeeping shortcuts; report missing preconditions and propose minimal repairs when possible; do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is consistency_auditor. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->consistency_auditor->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->consistency_auditor->goal}. Use action schemas: {model_action_schemas} and alignment: {aligned_state}. Validate Statement A user-proposed plan and indicate whether it achieves its goal; provide corrected steps if needed; note any insights relevant for compiling Statement B.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems for Fast Downward. Produce a clean STRIPS-compatible PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file; enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>; avoid duratives, numeric fluents, and conditional effects; keep predicate and object names exactly as given; if multiple statements are present, compile the problem for the last statement by default.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the action schemas {model_action_schemas}, the alignment {aligned_state}, and the audit {audit_report}. Target Statement B by default and generate a final domain and problem suitable for Fast Downward. Ensure actions reflect the specified preconditions and add/delete effects; include all referenced objects in the problem; set the initial state to Statement B initial facts and the goal to Statement B goals. Output only the two blocks <domain>...</domain> and <problem>...</problem>.
